top_categories.workout_context: Vuelta Altas Cumbres' Argentine Andes, South American gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 100 miles.
120ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Vuelta Altas Cumbres' demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before March.
At Vuelta Altas Cumbres, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
12,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
At mile 60 of 100, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Vuelta Altas Cumbres. Train it until it feels boring.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 100 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
12,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Vuelta Altas Cumbres, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 12,000ft of climbing on argentine Andes mountain gravel does to your power file on race day.
Low-cadence force work for 12,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Vuelta Altas Cumbres’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Vuelta Altas Cumbres with 12,000ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%. High altitude.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Vuelta Altas Cumbres demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride argentine andes mountain gravel at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: argentine andes, south american gravel, regional event. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 100 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 100 miles of argentine andes mountain gravel in Córdoba, Argentina.
